description: Fedora 39 atomic and gnome, it just needed to restart once to enable wayland. Obligatory -1 for proprietary software.

I've had countless problems with Zoom on Linux for years, but the Flatpak just worked immediately! No odd set up required, no audio or mic issues, nothing. It just worked. It took 3 minutes to install and restart to enable wayland (running OpenSuse Aeon).
Working as expected on Fedora 40 and Gnome 46 with Wayland. Didn't require any custom setup or configuration!
It works well BUT the version of zoom is OLD, ex. Zoom now has dark mode, this does not.

For some reason, the app doesn't launch anymore. 
I deleted and re-installed the app, but same result...

Hello all, I got this working, but it wasn't super simple:
andresmpr@fedora:~$ cd .var/app/us.zoom.Zoom/config/
andresmpr@fedora:~/.var/app/us.zoom.Zoom/config$ ls
andresmpr@fedora:~/.var/app/us.zoom.Zoom/config$ touch zoomus.conf
andresmpr@fedora:~/.var/app/us.zoom.Zoom/config$ nano zoomus.conf 
andresmpr@fedora:~/.var/app/us.zoom.Zoom/config$ ls
zoomus.conf
andresmpr@fedora:~/.var/app/us.zoom.Zoom/config$ more zoomus.conf 
enableWaylandShare=true
enableMiniWindow=true
XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP=gnome
andresmpr@fedora:~/.var/app/us.zoom.Zoom/config$ 


If you are using Fedora 40, which I highly recommend, because, I'm not using brand new HW, but I do have a Ryzen chip and ATI GPU, so Windows 11 hates my system, and Fodora 40 is just snappy, even compared to later builds 39 that I upgraded from.

Then to get silly Zoom opreating OOB, paste these lines into the zoomus.conf file in the above directroy for flatpak install (recommended). 

The three lines:
enableWaylandShare=true
enableMiniWindow=true
XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP=gnome

Enjoy!

description:
ZOOM.us in Linux of any form always lacks hardware video decoding, meaning that the app slows down my whole machine and uses a lot of CPU because video is decoded by the CPU as opposed to being hardware accelerated which is supported by most video playback programs like mpv.
ZOOM.us typically uses 300% CPU utilization while playing a 1080p H.264 video in mpv can be as low as 20%.
It is deeply important that this is addressed by any form on Linux. 
I couldn't find how to run the app in any other ways like via Anbox or using the Chrome app, which uses NaCl. The web app somehow consumes even more CPU usage even with full hardware H.264 en/decode in Chromium, because ZOOM.us doesn't use a standard WebRTC and H.264 spec.
This doesn't even address the intense privacy and security issues found in ZOOM.us and inherently because it's non-free software. Unfortunately millions including myself are forced to use this app to attend school. Yuck!
use the chromium client instead

Zoom works ok on Linux through the Flatpak and RPM although I had to fix a problem with the window being transparent at first. I managed to fix the problem on Wayland by going to the zoomus.conf file at ~/.config/zoomus.conf (or ./var/us.zoom.Zoom/config if using Flatpak) and setting enableAlphaBuffer=false to solve the transparent window issue!

I installed the Flatpak version on Fedora 36 on GNOME Wayland. And I was just on a Zoom meeting a few minutes ago before writing this. 

Thankfully, the app works now. 

Zoom will ask you to either restart or manually edit a config file to enable screen sharing on wayland. I chose the quick and easy option. I restarted Zoom and everything worked. 

BTW, check your settings to make sure sound output is set to headphones if you have them on. Happened to me :-)

description: By default on Wayland the windows are invisible. The way you fix this on the Zoom Flatpak is to edit /home/(username)/.var/app/us.zoom.Zoom/config/zoom.conf and ensure enableAlphaBuffer is set to false.

description: Was in Windows und Mac funktioniert, ist unter Ubuntu/Flatpak nicht möglich, auch wenn man die gleichen Beträge bezahlt.
Über die App lässt sich seit einigen Wochen kein Meeting mehr öffnen, es kommt immer zu Fehlermeldungen. Dadurch ist Zoom für mich von diesem Gerät aus unbenutzbar.

Die Verwaltung von Nutzern ist ein Desaster, auch bei wiederkehrenden Veranstaltungen gibt es kein System – das können andere Tools wesentlich besser. Überhaupt wirkt die Anwendung inkonsistent in der Nutzerführung und ist sehr viel verwirrender als die Alternativen.
Die Video- und Audioqualität ist allerdings gut. Leider ist die App instabil, bricht ab, startet neu (was besonders problematisch ist, weil ggf. der Host abschmiert und dann die chaotische NutzerInnenverwaltung einen Neustart der Konferenz sehr langwierig macht). 
Auf Wayland gibt es außerdem keinen Support für Desktop-Sharing. Auf macOS startet die App u.U. den gesamten Rechner(!) neu.
Nutze es jetzt seit einem 3/4 Jahr ohne Probleme.

Почти каждый раз при подключении к видеоконференции выдает окно с отчетом об аварийном завершении, конференция тем не менее запускается.

Трансляция экрана в начальной конфигурации не работает: доступна только опция перемещаемой рамки, которая на самом деле не перемещается. Нужно включить в настройках трансляцию в полноэкранном режиме по умолчанию.

Приложение любит внезапно максимизировать окно видеоконференции, когда другой участник включает трансляцию экрана. Когда переключаешься между окнами или виртуальными экранами, любит уменьшить окно в парящее над другими окнами мини-окошко, из которого нужно возвращаться в полное окно отдельным действием.
